thread.section_title: Economic and stock market news in Europe | MarketScreener
thread.title: Milan continues bearish course; good TIM on Mib - MarketScreener
thread.title_full: Milan continues bearish course; good TIM on Mib - MarketScreener

author: MarketScreener
title: Milan continues bearish course; good TIM on Mib - MarketScreener
text:
(Alliance News) - Sales continued to prevail at Piazza Affari in mid-session Tuesday as other European stock markets continued to contrast.
In the morning, Istat reported that in October, Italy's trade surplus widened on an annual and monthly basis.
Italy's trade balance with foreign countries in October recorded a surplus of EUR5.15 billion from EUR2.58 billion recorded in September and compared to EUR4.50 billion recorded in October 2023.
Thus, the FTSE Mib is down 0.7 percent to 34,482.64, the Mid-Cap is down 0.5 percent to 47,945.11, the Small-Cap is in the red 0.5 percent to 28,399.51, and Italy Growth is up 0.2 percent to 7,840.66.
In Europe, London's FTSE 100 gives up 0.8 percent, Paris' CAC 40 is in the green by 0.1 percent as is Frankfurt's DAX 40.
Among the day's other macros, the ifo reported that sentiment among businesses in Germany deteriorated. The ifo Business Climate index fell to 84.7 points in December, down from 85.6 points in November, its lowest level since May 2020.
On the highest-capitalization list in Piazza Affari almost entirely tinged with red, Telecom Italia is among the few bullish performers, advancing 0.4 percent. It is reopening the race on the company, which is composed of the Enterprise (large customers), Consumer (retail), and Brazil divisions after the sale of the network to the KKR consortium.
According to Bloomberg, the CVC Capital Partners fund, which holds 70 percent of IT specialist Maticmind in Italy, is reportedly considering buying Vivendi's stake. The French media company, with 23.8 percent, is TIM's largest shareholder, although it has no role in governance.
Also up are STMicroelectronics and Stellantis, up 0.8 percent. Also doing well are Brunello Cucinelli in the green by 0.7 percent and Iveco Group, up 0.6 percent.
Azimut Holding -- in the red 0.5 percent -- announced Monday that it has completed a strategic partnership with funds managed by Oaktree Capital Management. As part of the transaction, for a total company valuation of AUD690 million, Oaktree invested AUD240 million to acquire a stake in the financial and accounting advisory network of Azimut's Australian subsidiary, AZ Next Generation Advisory.
Azimut retains a long-term strategic stake of at least 25 percent in AZ NGA, along with shares held by local management and consultants, confirming its commitment to the company's long-term growth, according to the note released.
Hera -- in the red by 1.6 percent -- announced Monday that subsidiary Hera Comm and Ascopiave -- in the red by 1.3 percent on the Mid -- have signed in Bologna the deed of sale by the latter of 25 percent of the capital of EstEnergy, the commercial joint venture established in 2019 that constitutes the largest energy operator in the Northeast.
The transaction has a countervalue of approximately EUR232 million.
On the Mid-Cap, MAIRE gives up 1.3 percent. The company reported that its subsidiary Nextchem, through MyRemono, has signed a Toll Manufacturing agreement with Röhm, under which Röhm will supply MyRemono with scrap PMMA to be processed and chemically transformed into ultrapure monomers of virgin-like quality.
OVS remains bullish, as at the open, but slows, and is now up 0.6 percent. The company reported Monday that it closed the third quarter to Oct. 31 with adjusted pretax income of EUR24.1 million, a 71 percent improvement from EUR14.1 million in the same period of 2023.
Net sales amounted to EUR414.7 million, up 13 percent year-on-year from EUR367.6 million.
Webuild gives up 0.6 percent. The Strait Bridge, Milano Fiananza reports, is awaiting final approval from Cipess, the Interministerial Committee for Economic Planning, but Webuild CEO Pietro Salini said he was "confident" about the go-ahead.
"I have some news that makes me more optimistic. We are waiting and ready to go as soon as they give us the order," Salini told Milano Finanza during the presentation of the Murales project for the Piazza Venezia stop of Rome's Metro C.
Zignago Vetro--declining 0.9 percent--reported Thursday that the board of directors has appointed CEO, Biagio Costantini, also investor relations manager, and CFO, Cristiano Bonetto, as manager in charge of preparing corporate accounting documents.
On the Small-Cap, Eems Italia continues the bullish trend and now gains 12 percent. The company announced that it has signed a preliminary agreement to take over the entire share capital of Pay Store for EUR2.5 million.
Pay Store is a company whose business is aimed at businesses and retailers, offering top-up, payment, and multiservice services across the board, and has achieved market goals and consolidation by offering its services, without activation fees, to bars, tobacconists, and other businesses throughout the country.
Best of all does Digital Value, up 8.5 percent. Technoprobe follows, up 1.3 percent.
Seco is advancing 1.3 percent after announcing Monday the signing of a strategic agreement with BDTA - the Federal Association of Tobacco Wholesalers and Vending Machine Operators in Germany, which represents Germany's leading tobacco vending companies.
The collaboration will cover more than 200,000 devices in the tobacco vending machine industry, supporting new opportunities to improve operational efficiency and optimize management.
Among SMEs, Culti Milan gives up 0.8 percent. The company announced that it has reached an agreement with partner MGB Srl to sell part of its 25.1 percent stake in subsidiary Bakel Srl for a total of EUR1.2 million.
Simone -- in the green by 0.5 percent -- announced Tuesday that Banca Valsabbina SCpA has subscribed to the entire bond issue for a maximum amount of EUR1.5 million.
"As previously communicated, this simple, non-convertible, non-subordinated, unlisted bond issue will be used to conclude strategic extraordinary finance transactions for the development of the business, in line with market opportunities and programmatic growth lines declared during the IPO," the statement read.
ErreDue is not yet trading. The company announced Tuesday that it has signed a EUR300,000-plus deal for the development and supply of an innovative hyperpure nitrogen generation system, installed inside a 40 High Cube container, with a global leader in components for cars, motorcycles, and commercial vehicles and also active in motorsport.
Maps rises 0.3 percent. On Monday it announced that it had won a new contract worth a total of EUR532,000.
Next Geosolutions Europe - in the green by 1.1 percent - on Monday reported winning a major contract worth about EUR43 million with TenneT TSO BV.
ISCC Fintech - up 3.0 percent - announced Monday that it had finalized the purchase of a portfolio of unsecured individual and corporate NPL loans, traceable to the secondary and financial markets, with a face value of about EUR132 million.
In Asia, the Nikkei closed Tuesday down 0.2 percent to 39,364.68, the Shanghai Composite lost 0.7 percent to 3,361.48, and the Hang Seng finished down 0.5 percent.
In New York, the Dow closed yesterday down 0.3 percent to 43,717.48, the Nasdaq rose 1.2 percent to 20,173.89 while the S&P 500 gained 0.4 percent to 6,074.08.
Among currencies, the euro changed hands at USD1.0484 against USD1.0497 in Monday's European equities close. The pound is worth USD1.2692 from USD1.2685 last night.
Among commodities, Brent crude is worth USD73.73 per barrel from USD73.74 per barrel at Monday's close. Gold trades at USD2,640.80 an ounce from USD2,677.56 an ounce on Monday evening.
Tuesday's macroeconomic calendar includes, at 1430 CET, from the US, the retail sales report, followed at 1515 CET by the industrial and manufacturing production data. In the evening, at 2230 CET, it will be the turn of weekly oil stocks instead.
By Chiara Bruschi, Alliance News reporter
Comments and questions to redazione@alliancenews.com
